page.title: 17BUILDINGS IN CASTLE CARROCK
page.content: The first reference to CASTEL CAIROC was in 1165. The actual castle site is unknown, but may have been behind the present-day church. The church lies on a medieval site, with a gravestone beside the altar raised in 1346. Most of the present day building dates from 1828. Garth House, a large house overlooking the village, was built in 1667, and the Rectory in 1727. Many local farms date from the 19th Century as do most buildings in the centre of the village. By the late 19th century the Watson family owned most of the village. They restored the Church in 1888, funded the Village Hall (the Watson Institute), three tithe cottages, and their own Gelt Hall - the largest building in the village.
